definition[0]: preparing and sending to customers lists of amounts of money owed for goods or services
example[0]: Ineffective credit control and billing procedures resulted in an unacceptable level of bad debts.
definition[1]: the total value of sales made by a company in a particular period of time
example[1]: The company’s UK turnover was £2.5 million, with world-wide billings around £7 million.
definition[2]: the way that something is described in advertisements
example[2]: Only a small number of overseas visitors attend each year, and the festival hardly merits its ‘International’ billing.
